instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1534: What is A1534? A1534 is a model number for a 12 inch size Macbook  from years 2015, 2016 with EMC 2746, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00045, 820-00244..
definitions.820-00045: What is 820-00045? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.820-4049: What is 820-4049? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V3_S0: What is PP3V3_S0? The "PP3V3_S0" rail in a MacBook logic board is a power rail that supplies 3.3 volts to the system when it is fully awake (S0 state). .

threads.title: [SOLVED]<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1534</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> pita
threads.message:
Hello,

We have received that MacBook retina 12" 2015 for servicing with a broken charging port.
Charging port will work but not lock the charging cable.
Other than that, Mac was working fine.

After pulling out the computer and replacing the USB-C cable, we can't get it to boot up with a new charging port.
Board gets hot but nothing on the screen,

If we put back the original USB-C port, it boots up.

One more thing, if we plug the cable to the audio board, it will never start as well.
We have also tried a new cable+audio board with no success.

So, to summarize, with audio cable/board plugged, board will never start.
With new USB-C connector+cable, won't start either but with old port, it will start.

Board looks clean under the microscope, no knock off components found.

I am just clueless with this board.

Has anyone suffered similar issues with these Retina 12" boards?

Thanks.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1534</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> pita
threads.message: There are different cables, have you checked part numbers on them? Are they even known good? China picked them from the trash probably.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1534</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> pita
threads.message:
After some test, we've found out that when the board <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4049</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A is plugged, <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0</SIGNAL> is shorted.
Parts number are the same.

We suspect that originally the cable 821-1910-A was bent and created a short. After plugging the new board with the faulty keyboard we did short the 2 different boards we had.

Anyone has the schematic for the Audio board <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4049</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A please?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1534</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> pita
threads.message: No schematic for that. Either using the wrong cable or wrong board or the audio board is just dead. Cable not plugged in upside down?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1534</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> pita
threads.message:
You got it. It was. These connectors/cables are confusing.
Same connectors but on the MLB, connections are facing down, on the audio board facing up.

My apologies.
